profile_positions.description:
As Fleet Manager I am part of the management team and reporting directly to a member of the Executive Committee 

Environment/Setting:

•	NHV Is a fast growing international helicopter transport company, with HQ in Ostend-  Belgium. Momentarily some 500 employees work at NHV.
•	NHV activities are situated in Belgium, Holland, France, the United Kingdom and West-African countries (Ghana – Kenya - Togo).
•	NHV daily provides Off & On shore helicopter services for the Oil & Gas Industry, the Belgian & Dutch Shipping Pilot Services, French & Belgian hospitals, the Dutch Government and the French marine.
•	NHV is also an official Eurocopter Maintenance, Distributor & Service Center, with base maintenance stations in Belgium & Ghana


Main Result Areas:

Responsible for the continuing airworthiness management (EASA Postholder Part-M) of the NHV fleet and delivering technical solutions, products, continuous improvement of the maintenance processes of the Part-145 maintenance organization and participation in various technical projects.

The mission statement of the fleet department is "To be the provider of the right, cost most effective aircraft on time required by the NHV Business Units".

• Managing a 20-person staff department and directing the activities of:
* Maintenance Engineering
* Airworthiness Review
* Technical Records
* Supply Chain management
* Warehousing Store

 • Setting up the new Fleet management department merging the former Part-M, logistic Cell and Logistic Support into onbe team, with key focus in aircraft availability.
 • Rearranging the maintenance engineering processes after introduction of a new ERP software (RUSADA)
 • Introducing additional helicopter and new helicopter types into the NHV fleet (EC175 & AS332L2)
 • Implementing optimisation tools such as LEAN and Six Sigma.
 • Lead the investigation teams for incidents, near misses and accidents and communicated with external parties
profile_positions.title: Fleet Manager (EASA Postholder Part-M)

profile_positions.description:
In the position as System Engineer Avionic, I was responsible for the design and certification for helicopter modifications.

During this period I worked on the following project:
- AS365N2 SSCVFDR modification (Installation iaw JAR-OPS3)
- AS365N3 Upgrade Support for Heli-One Aberdeen (FMS, TCAS, CPI, HEEL, VHF-FM, NAV Switch)
- EC155 Avionic Upgrade (FMS, TCAS, HEEL, CPI
- AS332M1 Nordic Battlegroup (Cock[pit upgrade, classic -> EFIS, MFD, Missile detection)

On request of Heli-One Vancouver I have done the factory acceptance of 2 new AS365N3 and both of the new EC155B1.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all Schreiner helicopter maintenance facilities of avionic/electrical support. As well on scheduled maintenance as for troubleshoot problems (for all Schreiner A/C types S76/S61/SA355/AS365 & MD902).

As Type Engineer for the AS365 and S61 fleet, I was responsible for the Aircraft Maintenance Program of this helicopter type. This includes the evaluation of the appropriate documentation (airworthiness directives, service bulletins, CSN’s etc.)and the annual aircraft/component reliability program.

As dedicated Avionic Design Engineer of Schreiner (nowadays CHC), I was responsible for all avionic modifications for helicopter systems. These modifications are required to comply to the latest regulations or company, customer requirements. All modifications are approved under JAR, FAR or EASA part 21 design requirements. Examples of a few resent modifications are a.o. FMS, FLIR, HF, HEEL, CPI 406, Nav switch, Chip detection etc.
profile_positions.title: Maintenance Engineer Avionics
